tasks.task: Farming operations for cotton cultivation and processing
subtasks: Plowing the field
Adjusting soil pH if necessary
Applying organic fertilizers
Mixing decomposed organic matter into the soil
Applying chemical nitrogen, phosphorus, and potassium fertilizers
Planting cotton seeds at proper spacing and depth
Irrigating after sowing
Monitoring soil moisture during growth
Managing weeds with mulch or herbicides
Protecting against pests and diseases with pesticides or biological controls
Pruning and pinching cotton plants
Using modern cotton harvesters for efficient and controlled fiber collection
Compressing harvested cotton into large bales directly within the machine
Wrapping bales with protective materials for transport
Transporting bales by road or rail to processing plants
Cleaning raw cotton to remove seeds and dust
Combing and straightening cotton fibers
Drawing fibers into thin strips for spinning into yarn or fabric
Spinning cotton into yarn or fabric fibers using modern machinery
Rolling cotton into large bales for fabric production
Weaving cotton into fabric using automated weaving machines
